thread.title: Working for the Weekend, Lawmakers Dress Down

author: Byron Tau
title: Working for the Weekend, Lawmakers Dress Down
text:
WASHINGTON—One of the first victims of the government shutdown: the dress code.
Capitol Hill—usually a staid, formal workplace where members of Congress refer to one another as “gentleman” or “gentlelady” in debates and where the use of “Mr.” and “Ms.” never went out of style—has seen an outbreak of casual attire since government funding lapsed in the early hours of Saturday morning.
Though...
